definition: lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
surname Qu
how can it be that?
big/stream or canal/drain/ditch/CL:條|条[tiao2]/him (dialect)/outer rim of a carriage wheel (old)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

sentences.english: Fill with dry food, Daiyu San clear, accumulated bit by bit, and conditions are ripe.
sentences.chinese: 饱带干粮，晴带雨伞，点滴积累，水到渠成。

sentences.english: And Wang Yizhou said what the"China School"really needs is the time and more study.
sentences.chinese: 王逸舟等表示中国理论水到渠成，不应急于苛求学派。

sentences.english: All seems so natural and unbending, just like everything had been ready in advance.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是那么自然和随意，那么水到渠成。
其他的东西都会水到渠成。

sentences.english: He believes that the skill arrived natural success will come.
sentences.chinese: 他相信功力到了自然水到渠成。

sentences.english: Studies, family, career, they all came when they needed to.
sentences.chinese: 学业，家庭，事业，都是没有仔细想过就水到渠成了。

sentences.english: This has been a season when everything has come together to make his candidacy unimpeachable .
sentences.chinese: 特别是今年，他的当选是无懈可击，水到渠成的。

definition: logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
to let nature take its course (idiom)
when the melon is ripe, it falls (idiom); problems sort themselves out in the fullness of time
involuntary/automatically
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
to spread out bedding/bedcover
the time is right, geographical and social conditions are favorable (idiom); a good time to go to war
pinyin: tian1 shi2 di4 li4 ren2 he2

definition: to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to everyone's delight and satisfaction
lit. (bamboo) splits when it meets the knife's edge (idiom)/fig. easily solved
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
foregone conclusion/to be settled conclusively
imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
